meanings.definition: to be inclined or tending towards a particular course of action
meanings.sent1: She is propending to start her homework early.
meanings.sent2: The students are propending to participate in the school play.
meanings.sent3: His propending decision to join the chess club surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The propending storm of change is on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The propending deadline for the project motivated her to work efficiently.

meanings.definition: looming or impending in a threatening manner
meanings.sent1: The propending clouds signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The propending darkness made the forest seem eerie.
meanings.sent3: The propending exam filled the students with dread.
meanings.sent4: The propending danger forced them to evacuate immediately.
meanings.sent5: The propending disaster was averted by quick action.
